Twins Shut Out Tigers
The Minnesota Twins got a stellar performance from pitcher Cole Hamels, who handcuffed the Detroit offense en route to a 7-0 win at Target Field. Hamels, the winner, moves to 9-4. He threw 7 innings of 3-hit ball, while fanning 6 and giving up 3 walks. Detroit has now lost 5 in a row.

In the bottom of the third inning, right fielder Mike Papi came through big-time for the Twins. With Minnesota leading 1-0, he belted a 2-run home run.

Hamels attributed the win to "energy and focus on the part of everyone."
